Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adkers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently remodeled and is beautiful, as well as eco-friendly. This was the first breakfast included hotel we have stayed in that actually let us use real plates and silverware instead of Styrofoam. I know that is hard on the staff, but I really appreciated not throwing so much away. The staff were knowledgeable and kind. Breakfast was good. We left our car there for a week and felt the price to do so was reasonable. The shuttle was prompt and clean. Our car was safe while we were away (not a given in Montreal). I highly recommend this hotel for park and stay when flying out of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great buissines hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bernardo P
Reviews.Content: I spend two weeks in the hotel for bussines and I can say that is really great! What I like the most was the great staff they have. The offices I was working are 15 minutes from the hotel and every day they take me to my job and they pick me up back to the hotel, I realy apreciate that! All the people working there do their best to make feel you confortable and indeed they did it. In the room, you will find two tvÂ´s an iron, a little frigo and a cofee maker. The bed is king size and is very confortble. The only but are the pillows, are not super confortable but you have plenty. If you want to visit Montreal, maybee this is not the hotel, since is very far form all the atractions, I mean you can go to the downtown by bus and metro, but yes, is kind of far. But if you are going to have bussines in the zone, or you are on transit this is the hotel!, Is like 5 minutes from the airport. The breakfast is not bad at all, and also inside the hotel sell some snaks and frozen food to eat in the room. For sure if I need to return, I will stay again in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and a very nice room”
Reviews.Author: CanJamHolland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our 10 hour, overnight stop-over in Montreal. We called from the airport to confirm our reservation and the service desk was very helpful telling us that the shuttle was broken but we could take a taxi and they'd pick up the tab. While the hotel is only 5 minutes or less from the airport, a taxi ride is $14 (minimum flat rate from airport) so, it's great they covered the cost and usually have a free shuttle. At 5:30am, with the shuttle still broken, one of the staff drove us back to the airport. The hotel is quite nice with a very pretty lobby. The room was bigger than I expected, very crisp and clean and had a comfortable bed. Big bathroom too! It's too bad we only had about 6 hours there! We had to leave too early for breakfast but, from what I understand, it was included with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Summarize”
Reviews.Author: The_Summarizer
Reviews.Content: Location-close to the airport but very far from the city. Price- Fair. Service- Very good. WIFI- for free. Cleanliness- very good. Summarize- Recommend for busniess trips

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight hotel”
Reviews.Author: matteomontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the express for one night with my girlfriend. Not a dissapoinment but little odds and ends could be looked at. The rooms are big with a great bed, washirooms are quit big as well. The location is by the airport so not many restaurants but free shuttle service Romans from the airport( keep inundate I'm from Montreal and just giving u my observations) breakfast was good(free) pool and sauna was a nice touch. Peking was no problem(free) only complaint was the heater in the room. It would go on and off to keep the same temp but it was loud everytime it went on. Very thin walls, but it's a hotel. All in all good hotel. I would say again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern interiors”
Reviews.Author: bettylopez10
Reviews.Content: Positive: 1) Free Internet 2) Free breakfast compared to Holiday Inn down the road which charges$20 for breakfast(Holiday Inn Montreal airport 6500 Cote De Liesse) 3) Bigger rooms (we stayed at a Junior suite with an ante room) which has 2 TVs 4) Room has a small kitchen with a microwave,coffee maker and refrigerator 5) has free airport shuttle 6) comfortable bed 7) Free Coffee 24 hrs a day at the lobby 8) Scented lobby(they have this perfume wafting in the air) 9) Free parking 10)Allows delivery from outside restaurants since they dont have a restaurant. Negative 1) Would prefer a carpet rather than a laminated floor(which they have in rooms) which is not heated.When we went inside the room, the laminated wooden floors were so cold; 2) Internet specially on the 6th floor is weak if you will be using 2 lap tops in the room 3) Coffee maker we had was not so clean(I had to clean it again) 4) Breakfast was free but limited choice(bagels, croissant, all sorts of bread), cereals, scrambled eggs, hotdog and bacon, juice ,coffee, all sorts of butter , creme and fruit marmalade spreads and banana. 5) The surrounding area and parking lot is not plowed, quite icy and a bit dangerous if u slip.No salting of driveway. 6) Placing 2 TVs inside a room which has no partition is not advisable, you get divided attention due to the noise of both TVs. 7) I only saw 1 restaurant (Jumbo restaurant) around the hotel area.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Melanie P
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night at this hotel on a business trip in Mid-December and really enjoyed my stay. The room was wide, very clean, with a good flatscreen TV. I had the chance to get a wheelchair accessible room with a big bathroom and a huge roll-in shower, no bathtub. The room was very up to date with nice furniture and a nice desk. But the best part of the room, I would say, was the floating hardwood floor instead of the usual carpet ! I just loved it. I also visited the pool which was a tiny bit too cold and a bit small for me but still enjoyable ! There is also a spa in the pool area but it did not work at the time I was there. The staff was really helpful and friendly and always wore a smile ! The only downside was the free breakfast. I really did not enjoy the eggs. But the rest was ok. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and will stay again when I return to this area in late January.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Clean”
Reviews.Author: sallan71
Reviews.Content: Its a typical Holiday Inn and great if its a quick stay while transiting through the airport; however, if its for anything else beware that there is very else located close by. Choice of restaurants, shopping or entertainment is extremely limited. The laminate floors in the room are unique and you can tell that the floors are clean but other aspects feel somewhat dated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Pigburner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on a quick business trip. Conveniently close to the airport, although with the road construction at the airport entrance, I was glad to have brought my GPS or it would have been much more challenging to find. Room was very spacious, all hardwood floors were different, but nice. Comfy bed, lots of parking (no charge). Internet worked great. Everything was clean and in good working order. Price is probably reasonable for a big-city hotel near the airport, but was a bit more than I would normally pay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgm999
Reviews.Content: Positives: Good location, nice room, hardwood floors, no carpet, great continental breakfast, great staff Negatives: Noisy as a result of highway and airport, obvious dust/cob webs in corner of room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hooliganrugger
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the best Holiday Inn Express I have ever stayed in! It is also the best hotel I've ever stayed in around Montreal. The rooms are spacious and clean. The front desk staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful too. Located about 5 minutes from the airport, it was a quiet stay. You would not know the airport is nearby. This hotel is very close to many good restaurants as well. I highly recommend staying here when you are in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “New reno with a clean feeling.”
Reviews.Author: Land-air-c
Reviews.Content: First room might not have worked too well as it had an adjoining room door that was sound transparent. Quick call to the front desk and we were given a nice suite. Bit of road and departing aircraft noise but not so objectionable. Comfortable bed. Decent included breakfast opens at 05:30 so you can get your flight out. Front staff very helpfull and shuttle drivers as well. Recommend calling front desk to confirm pickup spot at the airport as it may have moved during construction.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for an overnite or multiple days”
Reviews.Author: airmike943
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on an overnight with a late arrival at YUL. The pickup was prompt. The room was clean and the bed comfy. I used a combo of points and cash for my room, but the rates are reasonable regardless. You get a nice breakfast with a good selection of foods included with most room plans. We went back to the airport with the van in the AM to P/U our rental car. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous15_11
Reviews.Content: Although I research hotels on TripAdvisor, this is my first review and I credit this hotel for that. My family and I were here for a short weekend visit to McGill. I was torn between staying here or a downtown hotel close to everything. I made the right choice. I checked out other 4 star downtown hotels and they could not compare. The design, cleanliness and full breakfast are excellent. The lobby area is impressive and spacious, same is true for the dining area. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was the equivalent of an apartment. Huge space, well appointed furnishings, and yes the laminate floors are truly special. The only negative is that it is situated in an industrial area, so no views or impressive location. We didn't care because it's less than 5 mins from the why to Montreal, and did I say free parking. If you want to pay more for downtown and get less then have at it. I will definitely stay here for future visits and recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Express.”
Reviews.Author: Mailmanwill
Reviews.Content: Well kept Holiday Inn Express. Nice lobby and decent breakfast area for an Express. Area very ugly and if I wasn't going to the airport I wouldn't stay here. I got a good price on the Travelocity secret hotel page (77 USD).

Reviews.Title: “perfect to catch an early flight”
Reviews.Author: zinlover
Reviews.Content: Mattress was exceptionally comfortable, sheets very good quality (custom made for the hotel). The facility was clean and modern. Breakfast looked good but because of our early flight time, we were only able to take croissants to go. Shuttle to the nearby airport was reliable and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Best HIX of hundreds I've seen”
Reviews.Author: bensagle
Reviews.Content: Wow! This is easily the most impressive HIX I've seen. Impressive lobby/atrium, massive suites, immaculate details... well done. Ask for the balcony suite. 8.5/10

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay - simply magnifique”
Reviews.Author: cruzan1
Reviews.Content: A one night stay yielded a clean, fresh, and crisp room on the 6th floor. Wooden floor, and absolutely clean room. Recommended for anyone with allergies. Room has a small refrigerator, coffee and tea equipment, and a microwave. Bed sheets and bath towels were white,clean and fresh. Simply one of the nicest hotel rooms I have stayed in,at any price. A few minutes from the Montreal airport, with a free shuttle. Absolutely magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location not so much”
Reviews.Author: hundl1ng
Reviews.Content: It's a very good hotel with great service, so you will find everything that is neccessary for a seminar in the hotel or nearby. In that regard I can only recommend it! If you are planning to spend a good amount of time downtown, however, I would recommend different places because it is a 20 minutes drive to go there (and this only if you have a own car or use a taxi). You could also use the free shuttle to the airport and then pay 8 dollars for the bus downtown but this can take as much as 40 minutes depending on traffic. (There are barely no restaurants around.) This being said, the hotel itself has anything you need. There's free internet in the rooms (really fast!), a complimentary buffet breakbast, a pool, spacious rooms that are both clean and with nice furniture. The reception is very friendly and helpful. So depending on what you want or what the goal of your travels is, it can be a very decent place or not. For a seminar or so I would stay there anytime again because the hotel itself is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Dorval - kid friendly, a little noisy for business.”
Reviews.Author: zanezed
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice large rooms which are updated and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Staff were friendly. Pool looked nice, gym was nice too but weight machine was broken. Lot's of families and kids at this location - a little noisy in common areas for business trips. Free breakfast is tasty but is a busy kid-filled baby-crying free-for-all the weekend I was here. The weekdays it was much more civilized. Pancake machine was broken, and I was looking forward to using it as I have heard from friends that have stayed at other Holiday Inn Express' that it is kind of a neat thing and makes good pancakes. I gave this hotel a very good rating because it is clean renovated and comfortable. Staff were nice and the rooms were excellent. internet worked well and airport shuttle was fast.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is...”
Reviews.Author: Kr3m3Puff
Reviews.Content: Perfectly acceptable but wholly unremarkable hotel. Everything you would expect from a Holiday Inn Express. The staff are very friendly, which is the least of what you would expect. While it is close to the airport, it isn't wholly convient due to the amount of construction that is going on in Montreal at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: maganini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the second time in two months and came back because of its location, amenities and the lovely modern and spacious room, with very comfortable beds. The hotel itself, is very welcoming, beautifully decorated, clean, bright and modern. A bonus is breakfast, which is included and saved us from having to run around searching for food. Also included in the room is a microwave, small fridge and coffee machine, all of which came in very handy for our stay. Complimentary coffee and tea are available during the day near the breakfast area, and that is also a very nice and welcome treat, along with daily newspapers. All in all, a very nice place to stay and the only one we'll consider when travelling to Montreal. The swimming pool is quite large and very clean. There is also a hot tub and sauna in the pool area. The gym has modern cardio equipment and weights, along with a television for entertainment. Staff members are very courteous and extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly W
Reviews.Content: When we are travelling we always try to stay at a Holiday Inn Express, This was the best one by far....we are two adults one child, stayed in a Executive Suite w/ a King size bed and pull out couch, two flat screen tvs wet bar microwave and mini fridge ! no carpeting so the room had was fresh - my daughter and I have asthma and having no carpeting was a refreshing change... Breakfast was great too ! we will stay there again when we are in the Montreal Area.

Reviews.Title: “Park, Stay, and Go! option was perfect start to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: The_Tetreaults
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our vacation, and it was the perfect kick off to a wonderful vacation. The room was spotless - the wood floors are wonderful for anyone with allergies. The beds are very comfortable, and the room looked to be freshly renovated and very clean. The bathroom was a bit more dated, but still had some nice touches to show that the property was very well maintained. The reception desk staff were very pleasant, and are fully bilingual. One poor young agent at the front desk was being treated very badly by someone on the phone (not a guest!), and yet she maintained her cool and was very polite. When the phone call ended, she greeted the people in front of her as if she was having a wonderful day and happy to see them - very professional, I was impressed. We stayed here specifically for the Park, Stay, and Go! 7 day package that they offer. They also offer a 14 day parking option. This hotel was maybe a bit more expensive than some of the others near the airport ($145 plus tax for 1 night + 7 days parking), but after much researching the Holiday Inn Express offered the best mix of features. The shuttle service is 24hrs - some hotels only have the shuttle running at certain hours, like starting arting at 6am, or stops running at 10pm. The parking area is well lit and relatively secure. Lastly, the continental breakfast started early enough in the morning (5:30am) that we were able to grab a quick bite before our shuttle picked us up at 6am (thus saving us from having to buy breakfast at the airport). The hotel delivers on what they promise - no surprises from what is advertised online vs what you get when you check in or out. For our return pickup at the airport, when we called the driver at 11:00pm (our flight was very delayed getting in) to pick us up he said he would be there in 10 minutes, and he was. Because of many other flights being delayed and disembarking at once, he had several trips to make to get all the hotels guest back to the HIE. However, he let people know where they were on the list, and was able to make a return trip to/from the hotel in about 12 minutes. Not bad!! I would strongly recommend this hotel for this purpose - it may be a bit harder to reserve the parking package in the winter months, so book ahead if you can to avoid being disappointed. It's worth the extra effort!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: Congo41
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel , worth more than the listed 2.5 stars from Expedia. Nice free breakfast buffet. Park-n-fly option is interesting. Internet speed is higher than average. Beds are good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: PaulHoddinott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights during the Jazz Festival and travelled into the City by courtesy bus to the airport and the 747 Express (tickets from a machine inside the terminal or, if you have the right amount in cash, on the bus); this worked well. The hotel service was friendly, helpful and efficient. Our room was spacious, clean, comfortable and had the usual amenities. The hotel location is convenient to the airport, 5-10 minutes, and the courtesy bus was clean and well run. However, the location is in an industrial area and there was some truck noise from early morning; but no airport noise. Breakfast was included in the room rate; nothing special but entirely adaquate. Overall, this hotel provides good value and I would certainly use it again if at Montreal Airport or unable to get accommodation in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & delightfull breakfast!!!Definetly back for future business trips!”
Reviews.Author: RichardM68
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best hotels in the Montreal airport area! I have been flying in and out of Montreal for the past couple of years on business and I'm actually quite upset at myself (and at my secretary) that I did not book here earlier! By far the biggest bang for the buck! The complimentary hot breakfast was delicious and much better than the breakfast's (most of them cold) served at the other hotels in that area! The wooden floors were definitely a nice touch! Nice staff, free wifi and since one of my meetings was cancelled I had time to enjoy their nice spa facilities! I am undeniably telling my secretary to always book me here whenever I stay in Montreal. Great Hotel - 2 thumbs way up!!!

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: pinoy99
Reviews.Content: great room - lcd tv's - spacious bathroom - wood floors - fridge,sink,microwave, digital thermostat, free parking friendly staff free breakfast did not use pool

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: florida33301
Reviews.Content: Very clean, convenient to airport, computers and printers available to print boarding pass. Free breakfast begins at 5:30 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: UnderTheArch
Reviews.Content: Nice new building with salt water pool and work out center. Clean and comfortable rooms. Montreal Airport access highways under construction and made getting around a challenge. The hotel shuttle staff made up for it. You guys were great.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel for the price, especially considering it is a 2.5 star.”
Reviews.Author: CaptainDebonair
Reviews.Content: Big room. A few pillowcases were not sparkling clean, but that is to be expected. Beds were satisfactory. Washroom was well appointed. Price was $140 for the room. Microwave, mini-fridge, and granite counter all in good condition and very useful. We would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “okey-dokey”
Reviews.Author: tyhoon
Reviews.Content: To stay overnight in Montreal,I selected H.Inn Express Airport. Same as other H.Inn Express hotel in Canada,I have no particular dissatisfaction about their room. But breakfast was minimum and needs to be improved,I trust.

Reviews.Title: “Returning customer”
Reviews.Author: ALGM
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here twice in June 2010 and again in June 201 due to past positive experiences and the hotel's features. The entire hotel and rooms are amazingly clean. Rooms are modern (with flat screen TVs, fridge, wet bar, microwave, free wifi) and roomy, beds and pillows are extremely comfy, breakfast was good (with the exception of the eggs) and convenient and front desk staff is kind and helpful. No restaurants near by, but many delivery options. Will definitely return again when visiting Montreal and area!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vikingBeijing77
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, close to Airport with shuttle service. The hotel is new and instead of heavy (and in some hotels dirty) carpets, they have opted for nice wooden floors, which added to the general feel of a clean and nice hotel. My membership level was recognized. Breakfast was a very positive surprise â€“ itâ€™s free and still very nice selection and plentiful. Thumbs up! Internet was free as well as parking and reception gave good service when asking for directions etc. Location is typical for Airport hotel, so not that nice surroundings, but the hotel itself compensated much for that, and there was no noise to be heard from the Airport. Good hotel and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Clean Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: swimfast151
Reviews.Content: We vacated the dumpy Holiday Inn Midtown because it was so gross and decided to try this place. Yes its out of the City but we had a car so no matter to us. Wow what a difference, this place is nice, new and clean. We were actually Wowed! you know how some Holiday Inn Express's have crappy breakfasts? Well not this one, it was good. So, if you are familliar with the layout and flavour of the Holiday Inn Express this Hotel is the same as that but at the same time it is just super clean and new and very nice. Staff are great, I think they like working here. Loved it, recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but terrible service and maintenance!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoy21
Reviews.Content: The parking at this hotel is a bit trickey. We asked the checkin lady at the front desk. 1) You gotta enter the parking at Chemin de la Cote de Liesse and 55e avenue, the other entrances are blocked and chained. 2) You go right and you will see an mechanical arm and SPIKE STRIPS. This is the ENTRANCE to the parking lot. 3) Approach the mechanical arm and it will go up to let you through. 4) DO NOT STOP WHEN YOU PASS THRU THE SPIKE STRIPS, just regularly go thru them, when your tires go on them the recline. There is also parking before the spike strips and mechanical arm to the left when you enter. There was enough parking for all the guests at this hotel and there is no fee for parking. I would say this is the most SECURE parking in a hotel ive ever seen. To exit, there is another mechanical arm with no spike strips. You just gotta swipe your room card or press the intercom to front desk and they will open it for you. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Lobby and Checkin: When you walk in there is music, beautiful chairs, and a very nice rolling water ball thingy. Probably one of the nicest lobby's ive ever seen. Checkin was very easy and the lady was knowledgable. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Room: Me and my family stayed in the European Suite on the 6th floor. When you walk in on your left you will see a small flat screen tv with a I guess luggage bench. To your right is a double size sofa bed with a mirror next to it and an cabinet. Next to the cabinet is a rectangular table and chair. Beyond; on your left is a bathroom (cont.) and another bigger tv with a queen sized bed with matching side tables and lights. At the end of the room is a single seat char to the left with a lamp, air-conditioner, and desk with chairs. The room also has nice dark stain hardwood floors! FYI: The A/C unit was pretty quiet and there is very nice lighting everywhere in the room like pot lights, lamps etc. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Bathroom: The bathroom has nice dark granite countertops with a big wall mirror and adequate sized sink. The shower is a standard bath tub shower with a large shower faucet. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Amenities: (All on first floor) Pool: Its a pool.... what much can you say about it. It has salt water which is a nice change from the old smelly chlorine pool at some other hotels. I noticed the the lining of the pool on the of the sides is coming off. Hot tub: Again, what much can you say. It had jets but wasn't turned on. Sauna: Very nice sauna! It was small, but very nice. NEGATIVES: There wen't enough towels and the grounds were dirty. FYI: Needs room card to get in, and the view isn't that great. Computer room: Not really a room, more like a corridor on the side hidden. It has 1 HUGE iMac; very fast, fast internet etc. There was one more HP touch screen computer which i didn't use. It also has a printer (didn't use) and a scanner (didn't use) for light business use. Breakfast Area: Well this is where my title comes in. On the first morning when I went down there at 8 am all the tables were FILTHY. There were plates, food everywhere on the tables. I didn't even see a maid clean ANYTHING up there; but I think this was because there were 3 bus loads of korean travelers but really the hotel staff still needs to pay attention to the cleanlyness of the tables dispite and hoards of guests eating there... very very dissapointed ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Location: Being a native montreal resident I knew how to get around the terrible Autoroute 520/ Cote de Liesse expressway but for new people to montreal the location is HELL. If your comming from the Autoroute 20 East your very lucky. Just at the roundabout take the 3rd exit to Autorute 520 E / Airport and exit 55e. If your comming from the the Autoroute 40 EAST you either exit at Boulevard St. Charles in Kirkland and turn right and then take the 20 E ramp, or take Boulevard Sources in Dollard Des Ormeax (D.D.O) and take the Autoroute 20 E ramp. I suggest a GPS LOL ! -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Service: Oh my.... oh my god, the worst service ive ever seen at a hotel. 1) One night we asked for an extra pillow and towel and it never came. 2) Another night we asked front desk to send a technician because the freezer wasn't working. They never came. 3) Another night we asked for TOWELS, for our room to be cleaned ( This was at around 9 PM !) AND MORE TOILET PAPER. They never came. We didn't see that you gotta put the towels on the floor if they were to be cleaned, yet we did with some... BUT THEY NEVER DID IT. We didn't have anymore toilet paper so my husband had to roll some toilet paper from the washroom downstairs so we can use it. Later we went to the front desk for the towels.......... she said someone would come up but THEY NEVER DID. Liked: Room, lobby, public areas (lounge) Didn't like: Staff, Service, Maintenance. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Overview: Pretty much if you want a gorgeous room and hotel but want to have the crappy-ist service and maintenance STAY HERE... For this reason I definitely won't be staying at this hotel EVER again! Internet was slow in our room on the 6th floor. But it is very fast in the breakfast area and lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: rob_dufour
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express Dorval was amazing. New hotel and the room was beautiful laminate flooring and the furniture was very nice. I really like the new flat screen TV and the bathroom with the shower was really nice. We did not go for the breakfast but we will next time we rebook to go to Montreal. You could not hear the airplanes and I realised in the morning that the airplanes were taking off in front of our room. I would suggest that if you want to stay in Montreal choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More than met expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Chacharea
Reviews.Content: Airport hotels can be tricky. This was our first time at the Holiday inn Express on a stopover. It is nicely decorated and the staff is very accomodating. Breakfast was included. The King extended suite was huge and very clean. The whole hotel was spotless and even smelled clean. The beds are awesome. i'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “My truck was stolen from the parking lot in the afternoon!!”
Reviews.Author: LittleRedCorvette21
Reviews.Content: After checking in I parked my truck in the "secure" parking lot next to the hotel. There was an entrance and exit gate that you need your room card to exit with. My 4 year old Ford 450 was stolen 3 hours after I arrived in the middle of the afternoon. The thieves drove straight through the flimsy exit gate. The hotel later admitted that they had been having a problem with theft of this particular brand of truck but only mentioned this to guests staying for one week! The assistant manager replied to my many emails to Holiday Inn guest services to say that the hotel had one of the most secure parking lots in the city... I beg to differ. My trip was ruined as I spent the afternoon and evening dealing with my insurance and waiting for the police to arrive. I will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with the Park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: nomosnow
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the 3rd year in a row to fly out of Montreal on Vacation. We had booked 2 rooms for a 4 hour stay. The main reason for booking it was like in the past, we used it for the park and fly. However, on check in we were advised that their parking was full and that my package now didn't include parking. I had to drive to the Park N Fly lot and pay $90 to park at their lot. Meanwhile, I had booked well in advise and even had notes where they told me to catch the suttle at the airport. I was not very happy since this was the only reason I booked the hotel. However, the prior 2 years were good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Would go again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: blushink
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband after an event we had attended. The hotel was amazing. Renovated, Clean, and extremely comfortable for the price. I was amazed. When we got in the room I could believe there were hardwood floors. I think it's the first time i've gone to a hotel with hardwood floors. I loved everything about this hotel with the exception that I won't deny it's a little bit far from the downtown core if you want to go to the city. But if want to have a great place near the airport. This place is for you. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Candy037
Reviews.Content: I travel quite frequently and stay at many Holiday Inn's and what I can say, is you cannot compare this one to the rest. It is on a scale of it's own. Very beautiful rooms, with hardwood floors. HDTV, and a microwave in our room. We had breakfast in the morning, it was really fresh and very good. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. Very nice staff. They also have a salt water pool. Very close to the airport, sguttle service was very fast!!! I will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay”
Reviews.Author: avlea2
Reviews.Content: Everything you need is right here. We were here over New Years Eve, so they put us two floors away from the partiers. The little express breakfast is just what you need to get going on. It's included, and so is the wireless. The pillow cases are labelled "firm" and "soft," so you can take your pick. Very clean room. And I LOVE the laminate floors .. no more bug/dirt trapping carpet! Friendly bilingual staff. Only complaint: no easy chair for TV watching. Fridge and microwave oven included too. It's in an industrial area so the immediate view is not pretty, but from the upper floors you can see St Joseph's Oratory in the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cornish24
Reviews.Content: We had a one-night stopover in Montreal on our way to Vegas and decided on the Holiday Inn Express based on Tripadvisor reviews. It was an excellent choice. On arrival at the airport, we called for the free shuttle and it arrived within minutes. The driver was very friendly and helpful and got us to the hotel in less than 10 minutes. Check-in was fast and efficient and the room spacious and sparkling clean. I liked the wood floors--much cleaner than carpeting. There was also a microwave, small fridge, and coffee maker, and the beds were extremely comfortable. We needed to get to Longueuil to meet with family that evening so took the shuttle back to the airport to take the 747 express into town to take the metro. At the end of the evening, the shuttle took us back to the hotel--a very efficient service. As we had decided not to lug our laptop with us, we really appreciated the free internet in the lobby to check our email. Breakfast had a good variety including cereals, cinnamon rolls, fruit, toast, yogurt, omelettes, sausage rounds, and bacon along with excellent coffee and fruit juices. We enjoyed our stay and would have liked an extra day there, but we had a plane to catch. We had reserved a spot on the 9:30 a.m. shuttle, which got us to the check-in counter within minutes. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in town!”
Reviews.Author: JP58964
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite with a balcony, no smoking , for 120$ it was one of the best deal in town! the room are freshly renovated, it is just like a small condo! you feel at home!!! Will stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: grammy&grumpy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little hard to find due to the fact it was dark and raining. We came from the airport and if we had just followed the directions given to us by the hotel, we would have been fine. There are no places to eat right by the hotel and none within walking distance. Our rooms were great. We had the junior suite which was very large. The beds were very comfortable and the breakfast was great. I would definately stay here again if we were needing to stay close to the airport. Parking was free, but a little bit of a hassle to get from the parking to the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, cozy but far from restaurants”
Reviews.Author: carabasse
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of days at this hotel, I liked the most the cleanness of the hotel, and appreciated the hard wood room. The staff were ok. The morning breakfast buffet, while a bit limited, was very very convenient especially when you are on a rush. Also liked the gym . Overall, If I was to go again for business, I wouldn't mind staying there again, you get what you pay for in a nice way and that's all I ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent option if you have a car.”
Reviews.Author: cparmezzano
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy this hotel. Breakfast was very tasty (fruits, yougurts, bread, milk, juices, many options). Rooms were perfect and clean. The hotel is a bit far from the downtown, but if you have a car, itÂ´s around 25 minute ride to be there. Easy and quick! I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: subchat
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in and we have stayed in many chain hotels during our tour of USA and Canada. The rooms are huge and spacious more like a suite and very well equipped with2 large LCD TV's, a 3 piece sofa, large bathrooms and a safe,microwave oven and tea/coffee maker. Very comfortable beds and close to the Airport which was a boon since we had to catch an early morning flight to Miami. Cannot fault the Hotel for anything, its wonderful and well equipped rooms, beautiful looby, free internet in the lobby(there are 4 computers and the trick is to get hold of one early in the morning) and a well spread out breakfast buffet. All in all we had a wonderful stay. Staff are also very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Holiday Inn, I've experienced”
Reviews.Author: littleella
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel of its type. Hard wood floors... felt clean. Restaurant style breakfast area. Good swimming pool and fitness area. Not great for public transit and situated in an industrial area South of the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice room”
Reviews.Author: JuelzClarke
Reviews.Content: Never book through EXPEDIA!!! They charge a little more then booking directly through the hotel and if you need to change your reservation they give you the run around. I wish it was right in the downtown core but other then that it was perfect. Great parking lot with security gate. Very nice room, and super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice setup but don't go if there's an event / party”
Reviews.Author: janeontheweekend
Reviews.Content: We had trouble finding a hotel downtown in Montreal so got this hotel out by the airport. We had a room on the 2nd floor and had lots of trouble sleeping as a wedding was carrying on below us until late in the night and you can hear everything...even people laughing and shouting etc. Of course, the wedding party was also on the 2nd floor. I think the hardwood/laminate floors in the rooms didn't help as carpet would have muffled some of the noise. The room was well appointed, the triangular shower was awkward and breakfast had some mystery meat patty. Staff wasn't very apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “I've loved in apartments that weren't as large”
Reviews.Author: TinaTravelsAgain
Reviews.Content: We were in Montreal for a much needed weekend getaway. We booked a Merchant's Villa suite. I'm serious when I say I've lived in apartments that weren't as large! I don't know the square footage but it was more than comfortable enough for 3 adults. The hotel was booked solid (a wedding or wedding-related event was taking place) but we were able to check in with no delay. The staff was courteous, efficient and very accommodating. The Merchant's Villa suite is as tastefully decorated as the pictures imply, with attractive artwork on the walls, a sleek dining room table with two chairs, a (very) small desk area, sofa (sofabed) and ottoman in the livingroom and a french door that leads to the king bed bedroom. Each room has its own flat panel TV and gets many HD channels. The entire hotel, including the rooms, is wi-fi enabled. Each room had its own air conditioning unit and they were quite efficient (although somewhat loud). The Merchant's Villa suite also includes its own private balcony (although the view leaves a lot to be desired). The bathroom is very roomy and modern. It includes both a tub-shower AND a walk-in dedicated glass and tile shower stall. There is a kitchenette area which includes a breakfast bar (but no chair or stool), microwave, coffeemaker, mini-fridge and sink. It was not stocked, however. It would have been nice to have a few paper towels and disposable plates and utensils bundled up in individual packets. I don't think there was even a bottle of water. Now for the downside: location, location, location. Oy! As an airport hotel, one would not expect to be in or even near downtown. If you're looking for a walking hotel or one that's close to all the action or the sights, this isn't the place for you. We knew that when we booked and we were fine with it. It is in a light industrial area. The bad part is the hotel is on the 520, which is probably one of the most horribly designed roads I've ever encountered. Ever. I haven't been to much of Montreal but I can't imagine a worse area to drive around than the 520 and its surrounds. It is horribly, horribly designed. It is the poster-child for bad road design. The 520 is a limited access roadway with a solid barrier median and one-way "service" roads on either side. The service roads go in the same direction as the side of the highway they are on, so they really don't buy you much. There are very few opportunities to go either over or under the 520 and even when you find one, you may not be able to turn onto it because the side roads have minds of their own and may not necessarily lead back to the service roads. Basically when you're on one side of the 520, it is darn near impossible to get to the other side. Even the locals agree the 520 is a VERY poorly designed road. Maps don't/can't convey how bad this road is. I looked at a paper map, my GPS, Yahoo maps and Google maps. I think the mapmakers just gave up on this one. Go on, take a look, I'll wait. Sadly, from the hotel, one MUST drive to get to... well, to get to anything. As an Express hotel, they are not permitted to have a restaurant, so guests must either venture out on their own, order delivery (some really sad delivery choices) or bring something in. How I wish we'd known of the hotel's shuttle service; they will shuttle you to and from local restaurants! I didn't find that out about that until we checked out. I mentioned to the desk clerk how bad the driving was and she said, "Oh no!!! You should have asked for the shuttle!!!" They REALLY should play up that feature and tell guests as soon as they check in! We know for next time. And I'm sure there will be a next time. Other than the 520, however, we have only tiny complaints. Although the hotel is only two years old, our suite was already showing a few signs of wear. I don't know what people have done in this room (I probably don't want to know) but there were many, many patches in the walls. We know because the touch-up paint didn't quite match the original. So, we had a room with cream colored walls with pinkish polka dots scattered throughout. The suite had wood floors (not sure, but i think it was laminate). We love wood floors (very classy) but it might have been nice to have small area rugs at bedside (non-skid, of course). Overall, it was a delightful experience (520 aside -- have I mentioned how bad that road is?), and we'd definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A really good hotel but given the location a restaurant in the hotel would be nice.”
Reviews.Author: beaver055
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and the room was great. Breakfast was a buffet with lots of choices and restocked continuously. Location was convenient coming from the airport but it's a fair way from the city. Driving to a restaurant for a meal was a bit of a challenge as many nearby were closed, and being on a service road for the autoroute meant driving a long way before it was possible to turn around to get back to the hotel. The hotel did have some frozen meals for sale but these were not very appetising and a touch expensive. It is a shame that a hotel of this standard doesn't have a restaurant on the premises. The car park was not undercover, but it was secure as there was exit only with the room key (and it was free).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Shaked007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because our travel partners had one night only and had to fly out of Montreal the following day. We used the hotel also for Montreal sightseeing - It is about 30 minutes by car to downtown Montreal. The hotel was great. Very clean and roomy accommodations, excellent breakfast, nice staff. If you have a car, sometimes it is a good idea to stay out of town and get much better value for your money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: LLCalgary
Reviews.Content: The staff was polite but only marginally helpful. Cleaning fell short. I had to look under the bed for something I dropped and it was DISCUSTING how filthy it was. I asked for it to be cleaned for 3 days and it never was. Our group (as we had 3 rooms) asked for either towels or blankest that where never brought. There where No appropriate TV channels or movies available for young children. The beds and pillows where very comfortable and the room had a Refrigerator and Microwave so that was very nice. The pool was nice. The location was excellent. The breakfast was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Will Stay Again for Next Visit”
Reviews.Author: joellowsky
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Montreal was perfect for a recent 2 day jaunt into Montreal. I have no complaints. There was a large group (kids hockey teams, I think) staying in the hotel, but our service was in no way negatively impacted. We had a Junior Suite and felt very comfortable. The combination of good A/C, 2 flat screens and the hardwood floors really helped us feel right at home. Breakfast included in our rate was a very nice touch. From this visit I have nothing negative to report.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK, But It Ain't ALL THAT!”
Reviews.Author: romadaro
Reviews.Content: Usually the info on this website is pretty spot on in terms of honest opinions about a particular property and I have seldom been disappointed. But, this time I have to say that this place is way overrated. Like I said in the title, it's OK, but it ain't ALL THAT! To add insult to injury, I had previously booked the Aloft but after reading some of the reviews here, I cancelled and switched and I can't tell you how I'm kicking myself! First of all, the pictures on the website are much better than the actual appearance of the rooms and the general features of the hotel. But, the good thing is that it's clean, the service has been good thusfar and it's close to the airport, which will be a plus since we have an early flight out. Thank goodness it's only for a couple days because if it was any longer, I'd check out and move tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “A great launching pad for a European vacation.”
Reviews.Author: HowieDWaterville_VT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all you need, with free parking up to 14 days and shuttle service to Trudeau airport. So if you are going Air Canada or Air France, to Europe, for instance, give them a try. We will use this hotel again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “it was really a very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: nalana
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and well maintained, I stayed in a suite, no carpet which is better. the AC is quiet, was able to sleep while it was on. They gave me a crib for my baby and he was happy to sleep in it every day. Breakfast was included and it was a good one. Although it might be for business men, but for sure its a very good choice for people with kids especially small ones.

Reviews.Title: “More Than We Expected”
Reviews.Author: JackMandora
Reviews.Content: 13 family members (including teen and pre-teen kids) traveled to Montreal for a funeral. As advertised the property was close to the airport and easy to find. The front desk staff was very accommodating, friendly and professional. Our suite slept 2 in the bedroom and 2 on the very comfortable sleeper sofa. By all reports from the rest of the family, all the rooms were clean and serviced very regularly. Towels sheets and pillows available at all times. Our room had a small balcony, which was great if you smoked or just needed a blast of cold winter air. LOL. We expected the customary continental breakfast of muffins and fruit, and were pleasantly surprised to discover eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal etc. This hotel made us feel right at home, and for the language challenged, many staff are fluent in English. Although there is Wi-Fi, they also offered 1 PC and 1 MAC complete with USB ports, SD slots and a scanner complimentary to guests. Another great surprise. The only challenge is parking. Although complimentary for guests, it filled up very quickly on Friday night as the hotel was also hosting a small party. If I had to, I would stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start and finish to a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Haber
Reviews.Content: We were flying south on a Sunday and using the park and fly offer from the hotel so decided to drive to Montreal Saturday afternoon and make the hotel part of the vacation. A guy outside helped my husband find a parking spot after we unloaded. Lobby is beautiful. Computers and an airport departure monitor right there. Check-in was quick. A trolley was available so I was able to get the kids and all the luggage up to the room myself before my husband even got back from parking the van. Room is beautiful, with laminate floors, flat screen TV and large bathroom. Shower rod is curved outward for more elbow room in the shower. The view is industrial, but you're not going to an airport hotel for the view. Ordered an early dinner from one of the restaurants with menus available in the room. Delivery was quick. We took the food back down to the breakfast room. Much more civilized than eating on the bed. Beside the front desk there are also a few fridges with drinks, microwave dinners and a shelf with a selection of dry food for purchase. Visited the salt water pool after dinner (much better than chlorine). Everything was clean. Towels were available. Jacuzzi and sauna also available. Tried out the gym equipment in the morning. Everything was clean and in working order. The hot breakfast was good. Try the cinnamon buns! Check-out with quick and the shuttle bus appeared on time. Upon return a week later, we phoned from the airport and the received an apology that it would take 20 minutes for the shuttle as the driver had just left the airport. We still had to change into warmer clothes so that was fine with us. Sure enough he was back in less than 20 minutes and we were at the hotel loading the van in less time than it would have taken to do the park and fly lot at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Super high-tech, clean, easy and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: travelerlnd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express as heard it was the newest and best airport hotel in Montreal. It didnâ€™t disappoint. I chose to stay close to the airport as I had an early morning flight to Miami and didnâ€™t want to miss my little trip to the sun. The hotel was so clean and pleasant, much nicer than the old dingy Airport Hilton I used to stay in Montreal. I have to say, wow! WOW! Free Wireless internet, brand new flat screen T.V.â€™s with a great user-friendly interface. I had a great room and I suppose what struck me was how high tech this hotel was. I was also able to do park and fly which was very useful. Great value for money, a great price for such a new clean and high-tech hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Iwantitallnow
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice looking, very clean hotel that we had no problem at all finding with our Tom Tom. We stayed for a Saturday night and found it to be quiet and relaxing. We had a handicapped accessible room that was totally wheelchair accessible, which is not always the case. We were pleasantly shocked by how nicely appointed the room was. This was the first hotel room I have ever seen that had laminate wood flooring and the bathroom was quite big. The room had the same look and feel as the Soho Grand or Tribecca Grand hotel in NYC for much less money. The front desk staff were exceptional in their friendliness and willingness to help make our stay a pleasant one. The pool is quite nice with very cool lighting. The only downside that we found was the lack of a restaurant on site. They do offer a shuttle to a rotating series of restaurants but we didn't use the service. Instead, the front desk staff kindly ordered take out for us from a menu provided by the hotel. While the location isn't downtown convenient, this place is outstanding if you need a place in the Dorval area of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter857
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying what a beautiful property this place is, I have never stayed at a Holiday Inn Express that felt so much like home, I used to do a lot of business traveling before I had children and honestly I was a little apprehensive about traveling with small children but your hotel took all my worries away. The bed was the most comfortable bed that I have ever slept in a hotel, there's lots of space in your suites (plenty of room for the little ones) your staff is very warm and very kind. I was very happy with my check in the girl named Tamara took the extra time to explain all the amenities the property has to offer as well as what we could do with 3 small children over the weekend. We took the girls to the biodome and they really enjoyed that, we also whent down to the old city and it was beautiful. All in all I really enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn Express and Suites and if you love the feeling of being right at home when traveling this is definetly the place to stay :)

Reviews.Title: “This is an express !”
Reviews.Author: lucatuna
Reviews.Content: Not your typical express!. Great size rooms , modern decor very clean. Great airport location friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very easy and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sparky2012
Reviews.Content: Super fast/easy to get there from the airport with the shuttle bus, friendly staff, great room (wireless, 2 televisions), complementary actual breakfast (not just croissants). Great stay all-round.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojocks
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and beautiful as well as comfortable. The staff was very friendly. The airport shuttle was timely and the fact that I could leave my car there for a week at no extra charge was comforting. The shuttle was there again when I came back. I would definitely stay there again and have recommended it to co-workers.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately Seeking Definition of Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: wildlife_girl
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the rave reviews so I was shockingly disappointed upon checking in and it only got worse from there. The hotel is very difficult to get to but that is not the fault of the hotel, it is the poorly designed road system but I think folks should at least be aware. First to mention is that it is not $109 per night as even their website states. As a matter of fact, the woman who checked us in said that their rate hasn't been $109 since the hotel first opened. She had no answer when I showed her a printout of the $109 rate from their website nor would she give us that price. Fine, moving on. The hotel is nicely decorated as are the rooms. But we did not appreciate finding pubic hair on the sheets. It was obvious that the sheets had been cleaned and changed and it's one of those things that I think "just happens." But when we called to have the sheets changed, the attitude was as if we were "being particular" or something as if we found some dust â€“ I understand enough Spanish to have picked that much up. Ok, still not going to let it ruin the weekend. I didn't mind where the hotel was located because it is close to Dorval/Lachine where there are tons of great restaurants that line the waterfront. What I did mind is that while the front desk gave a full list of restaurant recommendations in Dorval/Lachine, they failed to tell us that they actually have free shuttle service to take you there. We found this out the next day after we battled traffic and driving around looking for parking. Also to note is that the hotel is located in an industrial area so it does smell like exhaust and fertilizer. Our first morning, we went to make coffee and noticed there was no artificial sweetener in the room. My husband is a diabetic and we called the front desk and were told by Tamara that they do not provide sugar substitute in the rooms. We asked if it would be available at the breakfast to which she replied she did not know (even though the coffee stand is 10 feet from the front desk). Apparently she not only didn't know but didn't think it was in her job description to even find out for us. When we expressed our surprise, she said "I WORK AT THE FRONT DESK" - CLICK! and hung up on us. Are you kidding me? Obviously, we immediately called back which is how we got her name. Oh and yes, they DO have artificial sweetener at the breakfast which we only found out after we physically went there ourselves to check it out. I travel a LOT, especially for work, so I've stayed in all kinds of hotels. I can honestly say this is the LOUDEST I've ever been in - you can't hear your neighbors above, below or next to you, but you can hear EVERYTHING that goes on in the hallways. We had to complain about the noise level the entire weekend and they really do nothing about it because it's usually one person at the front desk and no manager around during "quiet hours" and zero security. I haven't been this disturbed at all hours of the night even at convention hotels. On the plus side, they do have a pretty good breakfast included in the room rate - both hot and cold food - which we appreciated. There is no restaurant or bar at the hotel but you can purchase snacks and beer and wine next to the front desk. I will say we lucked out with some phenomenal food in Montreal so not having a restaurant at the hotel was no big deal. We did speak to the manager before we left and voiced all of our concerns. She assured us she will speak with her boss and contact us with a response and what they will do to accommodate our issues. Upon our return, I received an e-mail that said she was sorry about our stay and the inconveniences we experienced. WOW! I was not expecting a â€œtoo bad, so sadâ€� reply after the complete unprofessional attitude and behavior of her staff. In this day and age when customer service is so critical and companies compete to separate themselves from their competitors, I find this type of laziness and abundance of excuses intolerable. Everyone knows that mistakes can be made but the difference is in how you handle those issues. They say you get what you pay for and in this case, they couldn't be more right. If there was a lower rating than 1-star for service, they would be getting that from me.

Reviews.Title: “Superbe airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PL_Audrey
Reviews.Content: The usual airport hotel is old, noisy, and you would get bad service in and outdated room. Well, not at the Holliday inn express!!! We were really impressed by the desk service and the lobby in general. The rooms are very nice and carpetless! No carpet! How fantastic. The complimentary breakfast was very good, and included eggs and bacon and not only pastires and instant coffee other hotels offer you. They have 24hours shuttle and secured parking for park-and-fly. We travel throught Montreal once per season, and the Holliday inn just made it to our number one airport hotel. They will be hearing rom me again pretty soon!

Reviews.Title: “hard to find but worth it; great staff”
Reviews.Author: CCR1138
Reviews.Content: Although it was difficult for us to find the place (the street signs are wonky), I would definitely recommend this hotel if you have your own car and want a nice place at a good price. THE GOOD: Our double queen suite was spacious and comfortable. There was a fridge, microwave, coffee-maker, and free wi-fi. The pool area is very nice, perfect for our teenager to burn off some energy. Unlike most places, they actually offered wi-fi and wired access for their free internet, and the staff let me borrow an ethernet cable so I could have a secure connection. They also sent a fax for me without charge. The best part, though, was the breakfast. They had protein! This is very important for a good start to the day, especially for diabetics, yet most hotels only serve sugar and starch. I was pleased to be offered eggs and bacon as part of the complimentary breakfast. They also had a great pool for our teenager to burn off some energy. THE BAD: Besides our initial difficulty finding the place, I have no complaints. THE UGLY: Driving in Montreal is an absolute nightmare, but that's not the hotel's fault! This was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for airport”
Reviews.Author: Staro30
Reviews.Content: New hotel so everything is spick and span although the sauna was already out of order. Rooms are large and contain everything you need. Breakfast was great. There is a shuttle bus to and from the airport which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A Boutique Hotel hidden in an Airport Location”
Reviews.Author: shellymeister
Reviews.Content: I have been a Priority Club Member for at least 15-20 years, so I have stayed at lots of standard Holiday Inn Express(s). This hotel is truly a different (and kinda revelatory) experience. I would up using Priority Reward Points for our 3 night stay, which would normally limit my room choice to a standard 1 or 2 bed room . But the staff at the hotel was nice enough to upgrade our room to a full 1 bedroom suite, which was absolutely perfect for our needs (travelling with our teenage son). We had recently returned from a trip to Prague and Vienna where (relying on TripAdvisor again, we stayed at 2 terrific boutique hotels) and we were more than pleasantly surprised when we entered the lobby at this hotel and it clearly gave us the impression that a lot of thought and design went into creating this new kind of Holiday Inn Express. The staff greeting upon arrival was very inviting and one got the impression that the desk staff truly cared about our experience. We were additionally impressed that though we arrived relatively late (around 11:30pm), there were still 2 people manning the check-in. The look and feel of this hotel is definitely one of far more expensive boutique hotels, and that look and feel carried over to the 1 bedroom suite that we stayed in, which was tastefully furnished, including a dining table and chairs, 2 Flat screen TVs, a large bathroom, refrigerator/wet bar and very attractive and comfortable bedding. The hotel and our room were spotlessly clean, by the way. The breakfast area is also very tastefully done with a combination of tables and counters with bar-height chairs. The breakfast choices are more typically Holiday Inn Express style, but somehow seemed to be of better quality and taste compared to many other HIE locations we've stayed in. The parking lot was huge, well lit, and had wider than normal stall markings, which helps avoid those annoying parking lot dings. Two large elevators in the main lobby meant that even though the hotel appeared sold out, there was no long wait for an elevator. I have visited Montreal dozens of times so I was not at all concerned about the airport location of this hotel because, unlike other major cities worldwide, the Montreal airport is only 8 miles from center city. The hotel was located within a 2 min drive to Rte 20 (E & W) which is a major interstate type freeway which takes you directly into center city in less than 10 minutes. If this hotel represents the new direction of design and execution for future HIE projects (and also renovation), they are definitely on the right track. Boutique-style amenities at a fair price seems like a winning combination to me.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty neat place”
Reviews.Author: stumpyandsassy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay in something familiar before we went into Montreal's old quarter. We now wish we had continued here. Our room was modern "French". The floors were of a dark wood. There was a microwave, fridge and table to eat upon. The manager sounded so American that I asked him if he was from the states. He said he had seen alot of American movies! He also let us know about the food in their freezer that let our very tired selves microwave dinner there at the hotel. The breakfast was excellent. The staff friendly and helpful. Definitely a place we can recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MapleLeafTraveller11
Reviews.Content: My husband, baby and I just returned home from a 2 night stay at the Holiday Inn Express in Montreal. I chose this hotel because of the great reviews and it did not disappoint! Cleanliness is a must with an 11 month old crawling around, so we were extremely happy with the spotless rooms! The salt water pool area was also very clean and fully stocked with clean towels. Service throughout the hotel was great. The front desk staff, housekeeping, and the guy that continually cleaned the floors on the main floor always greeted us with a smile/hello! The only complaint I have would be with the number of staff working the morning buffet. Both mornings we had to wait while the waitress cleaned a table for us. It seemed as though this one lady was responsible for cleaning the tables, washing the dishes, setting the tables and stocking the buffet. I would recommend the manager hire one more waitress/waitor to help out during the morning buffet. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “This is great value for money, new and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: LynnNewfoundland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on way back home after family vacation to the US. We had been in four other hotels in 10 days and this was our favourite. Free shuttle to and from airport. Hotel is new and very modern, rooms were very nice, the breakfast next morning was great, hot and cold, serve yourself and open at 5:30 am. Only 5 minutes from airport and new shuttle bus provided by hotel, driver was friendly and dependable. My teenagers thought it was great with the new and modern decor, the lobby is very unique and beautiful, the computers were free access with large screens. Pool is a little small but as this is airport hotel and usually only one night stay that was fine for that purpose. We will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “stumbled upon this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tpgrand
Reviews.Content: On a roadtrip to Montreal, we had planned to not have a plan at all and stumbled upon this hotel near the airport. Most of the hotels in the city charge extra for parking and we preferred to not have to pay for parking. Therefore when we found this hotel we opted quickly to book a room. The hotel is located near the airport and luckily the drive into town takes about 20 minutes which is not too bad at all. The room itself was clean, spacious with two twin beds, and with modern amenities and totally perfect for at least 4 people traveling together. The one complaint I would have is that the windows did not keep out the noise of nearby trucks driving by in the middle of the night, which was a minor inconvenience. In the morning, the breakfast was pretty good, I would say a small step above the standard continental breakfast. Some hot dishes like bacon, eggs, and sausages were served along with the standard breads and cereals. Lastly, the hotel seems really new and their facilities are quite modern and clean, case in point the restrooms in the lobby were comparable to ones found in higher end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Its the perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tcob27
Reviews.Content: This hotel not only has great prices but great service as well. Everything was perfectly clean. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect when you want to be close from Dorval”
Reviews.Author: Elhajeb
Reviews.Content: We had a great time there the room are spotless, Breakfast is complementary. Parking is free fro resident. You will not miss your plane as it is 10 mins away from Dorval. they have ashuttle service and a big screen which flight departure information.

Reviews.Title: “what an excellent hotel, it deserve at least 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: zaknas
Reviews.Content: I will certainly recommend this hotel to my network... Simply because it offers the best Quality/Price Ratio. Adding to that, it's a brand new stuff with qualified people trying every thing possible to let you feel home.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable - Not close to anything”
Reviews.Author: JeepBuddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King suite which was very upscale in decor. Two flat screen TV's, laminate floors and a hudge bath with a glassed in shower. The bed was comfortable and the room spacious. The only thing we did not like is the A/C was loud and seemed to operate only on high speed. It was alright for sleeping but the TV had to be turned up too loud to suit me. Also there was a pool of water on the floor the next moring where the A/C had not been draining properly. I turned the unit off and reported that to the management at check-out. The staff speaks clear English which is nice because we don't speak French. Not speaking French makes driving in Quebec tricky. Luckily, our GPS took us through a maze of roads to this hotel. I don't know if we could have found it without GPS. The location seem convenient to the airport but not much else. That was OK for us since we were only passing through town on the way somewhere else. If you've had one HIE breakfast, you've had the majority of them. On rare occasions one will stand out. This was not one of those rare occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value!”
Reviews.Author: HilltopOttawa
Reviews.Content: My family accompanied me on a trip to Montreal for business, as we mixed in some family fun at the same time. Great hotel - nice new rooms, great pool, nice lobby, and polite, courteous staff. The breakfast buffet might have been the best feature - the food was excellent, and having it right there, and free with the room, saves you a ton of time and money. The price on the rooms was very competitive, and great value. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for park and fly!”
Reviews.Author: ottawamama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel overnight before flying out on vacation the next day from Dorval airport. We were a party of 2 adults, 2 teenagers and 1 6-month old baby. Rooms are great, large enough to accommodate all of us comfortably, had a mini-fridge, microwave and coffee maker (super handy with the baby), nice big bathroom, very clean. Free WIFI was also a big bonus for us given the kids had brought along their laptops ;-) Hardwood floors throughout the room, which I really appreciate. The hotel parked not only one, but two cars for us given that my husband and I had to drive down separately. There was free shuttle service the next morning at our convenience (no pre-set times, you reserve it the night before and its 24h service). We had to be out by 7.30h am, and had time to enjoy the complimentary breakfast buffet, which features hot items (eggs, bacon, sausage) and had a nice assortment of cereal, toast, yogurt etc. I was very pleasantly surprised by the breakfast buffet, as these are usually limited to stale croissants and toast. We enjoyed the pool the night before, and ordered out for pizza. I realised afterward that they had a nice selection of catered frozen meals for sale in the little shop downstairs, and would surely have tried that for a more healthy selection had I known. Staff was friendly and relaxed, including the shuttle driver (its just a short drive over to the airport, which is great). They came to pick us up as soon as we called from the airport on our way back, and getting our cars was easy and fast. Bottom line, you can't get better value than this hotel, especially if you are doing park and fly. It makes for a really easy and enjoyable experience. I am for sure going to do this every time I'm flying out of Montreal. You just can't go wrong with this place, especially given the very decent rates.

Reviews.Title: “more than you pay for”
Reviews.Author: arubalover08
Reviews.Content: In June 2009, I want to Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suite, at Montreal Airport. I was really surprise of what you get for the price. The room are clean and really nice. They don't have carpets on the floor and the room are big. You have a breakfast include and you have quite some choice, even tough is an "expres" breakfast. Coffee and tea are free 24h/day. There's a pool and a nice lobby to relax. You have acess to two computers (free) with wireless internet. The internet is free and pretty fast. Bathroom are clean and nice towels. There is a shuttle that take you to the airport. Altough we didn't stay to catch a plane, it's a good place to stay if you don't want to pay the full price (dowtown montreal). There no restaurants around, but you can ask for deliveries.

Reviews.Title: “They try harder - and succeed!”
Reviews.Author: Global-track
Reviews.Content: This facility was built in late 2008 and makes for a delightful stay. It's a little pricey, but so are all the hotels in that area. The facility is modern and perfect in every way, but it's the staff that takes it over the top. They take the time to fully explain all the amenities with each guest at checkin, and are responsive to any questions or problems. The complimentary breakfast tops anything I've seen at other hotels. The hotel is convenient to the airport and only 12 miles from downtown. It's in a light industrial area, which is the only thing I can think of as a negative. They have plenty of parking in a gated lot. I would not only recommend this hotel, I'll make it my choice in the Montreal area.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...no complaints”
Reviews.Author: DorotheeA
Reviews.Content: From the time I arrived till I left the experience was great. The room had hardwood...perfect...no dust...bright and the room was spotless. I was able to arrange for shuttle services twice without issue so that I could spend the day in downtown Montreal. I highly recommend this location....staff was great... DA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Esteban22
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express fulfilled every single need I had for a top-notch business hotel. With time at a premium, the hotel was able to accommodate me in every way, providing great service and rooms all within tight time constraints. Best of all, I was able to zip right over to the airport for my flight once my stay was over. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel with gorgeous rooms”
Reviews.Author: canuckbusinessman
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for its proximity to the airport and to accumulate my priority points. As a business traveller I have stayed at Holiday Inns all over North America. I have never seen rooms or amenities like this. The rooms are clean and sleek - mine came with two flat screens TVs. The hardwood floors were a great touch. I felt like I was in a uber-trendy boutique hotel in a cities downtown entertainment district. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: cruiseking79
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Montreal Airport. All I can say is wow! All rooms have laminate flooring with modern furniture. Extremely comfortable bed with flat screen tv. Complimentary wireless internet and full breakfast! Some hotels should be ashamed of charging for these in this day and age! Congratulations Holiday Inn Express! 100% better than the Hilton Montreal Airport! Try it... you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Genuine Service”
Reviews.Author: angie159
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this brand new hotel for one night the first week of April. The hotel product is beautiful! Contemporary, clean and comfortable. I was welcomed by John (evening Night Audit) and was pleasently surprised. Great genuine service and felt reassured that I was at a great hotel right away. Since it is an Express hotel there is not a restaurant onsite, however; the hotel offers an excellent selection of frozen entrees and even offers wine and beer from thier pantry. Very handy. The Breakfest Bar was consistent with all other Holiday Inn Expresses and the Breakfest Bar Hostess was very friendly. The best part of my morning though was when John (the same John that checked me in) came by to see how my evening was and wished me a good day. He even remembered my name! Great hotel, genuine service. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “My Airport Choice Everytime from NOW ON!”
Reviews.Author: FishingAllDay
Reviews.Content: Not sure how this hotel only has a 2.5 star rating, it is easily a 4 star! I was more than impressed with the room I had, this is a brand new hotel. King size bed, wireless internet, hardwood floors and flat screen TV with High Def channels. The front desk staff was amazing, arranged my free shuttle to the airport, and the wake up call I needed. The free breakfast was great, full service with eggs and everything else to start my day right!This is easily one of the best and affordable airport hotels Ive stayed at in a long time. Definitely the place to stay at the Dorval Airport!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice HI Express”
Reviews.Author: JadepearlToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 day meeting, close to airport but very hard to get to because of the road design. We rented a car, could see the hotel, but could find a way to get to it. Finally saw the hotel shuttle and followed it through the back roads. Otherwise very new, clean and spacious Holiday Inn. Hotel room had a very comfortable king bed, large bathroom with shower (no tub), microwave, mini-fridge and coffee maker, free wi-fi. Very strange, the wardrobe is inadequate, with only space for hooks, no rod. Felt like the designers added this in at the last minute. Lobby is spacious, nice size breakfast area with hot breakfast included. Several business meeting rooms are available and nice size with windows. Food is catered in and very good and plentiful. Adequate 24 hour fitness centre and also a swimming pool and sauna room. Service was friendly and great. ATe at Forcaccio near the hotel which had nice homemade Italian food at very reasonable prices. Went to Latin Quarters, Alos another night and the food was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate comfort and service!”
Reviews.Author: arbaa
Reviews.Content: The only downside to this hotel is the French only road signs! :D This hotel was amazing, I was impressed with everything. It has hardwood flooring, it is very modern and very stylish, huge lobby, clean and super comfortable from the bed all the way to the soft towels. They really exceeded the HI Express standards in terms of design. I currently am working in a HI-Express so trust this review !!! The staff was amazing as well, very warm and were quick to give us directions to anywhere and did not hesitate to ask how everything with our room was every time we passed by. Jacki and Russel in particular were great and gave outstanding service ! Thanks guys! I recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Next to Montreal Trudeau Airport.”
Reviews.Author: CND_Traveller_8
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I recommend it without hesitation. Here are some highlights: - Brand new construction and very clean - 2 Minutes from the airport terminal - Nicely designed lobby - Spacious conference rooms This is definitively the best choice for a hotel near the Montreal Airport.
